intro: Calopsis rigida, commonly known as the rigid calopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Calopsis rigida is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
